entry.title: [CSC] Produce more distinct errors
entry.content:
Allow Web applications to more easily distinguish the source of an error

by providing the following mapping of errors:

* NotAllowedError: User withheld permission (or the permission system

did so on the user's behalf, e.g. due to embargo).

* NotFoundError: Capturing or captured surface not found. Would normally

be encountered if the API invocation, which is asynchronous, roughly

coincided with the closing of either capturing application, the

closing of the captured tab, or the termination of the capture

session.

* InvalidStateError: The API invocation was disallowed at the current

state of the capture, e.g. if self-capturing. Note that this may

sometimes change due to asynchronous user interaction, as for example

with share-this-tab-instead being clicked. Another possible source of

this error is when the capturing application is not focused; this is

detectable by the app (through the blur event), but is not always

avoidable, as the user might activate another tab shortly after the

application calls one of the CSC APIs.

* UnknownError: This remains the catch-all error for any

non-differentiated error cause.

entry.title: Add enum for Autofill.WebView.Events histogram.
entry.content:
The original bitmask is simply too hard to read. I expect to remove

this histogram once AndroidAutofillSupportVisibilityChanges is launched.



The entries were generated using the following script:



def main():

components = [

[1 << i, name]

for i, name in enumerate([

"structure sent",

"suggestion shown",

"autofilled",

"changed field",

"changed autofilled field",

"changed visibility",

"submitted",

"bottom sheet",

])

]



def generate_labels(x):

joined_labels = ", ".join((label for bit, label in components

if x & bit))

return joined_labels.capitalize() if len(joined_labels) else "None"



for i in range(0, 1 << len(components)):

print(f'')





if __name__ == "__main__":

main()

entry.title: Reland "[base] Integrate (Sequenced|SingleThread)TaskRunner::GetCurrentDefault with RunOrPostTask."
entry.content:
This is a reland of commit aa9fbff84283de17fe0ee59c28c9edd50b7e6d3a



Gardener said that since

ToolbarControllerUiTest.DeactivatedActionItemsOverflow started

failing before this CL landed and kept failing after it was reverted,

they no longer think it was causing the issue.



Original change's description:

> [base] Integrate (Sequenced|SingleThread)TaskRunner::GetCurrentDefault with RunOrPostTask.

>

> Within a RunOrPostTask callback running synchronously:

>

> - There is no "current default SingleThreadTaskRunner".

>

> A RunOrPostTask() callback cannot make assumptions about the thread

> on which it runs, so it shouldn't access the current default

> SingleThreadTaskRunner.

>

> - The "current default SequencedTaskRunner" is the SequenceManager's

> default task runner.

>

> A RunOrPostTask() callback runs in sequence with tasks from the

> target SequenceManager. It's appropriate for it to access the

> "current default" SequencedTaskRunner.

>

> Also, with this CL, when

> SingleThreadTaskRunner::BelongsToCurrentThread() is invoked on a

> task runner that runs tasks posted to it "in sequence" with the

> current RunOrPostTask callback running synchronously, but on

> a different thread, it returns `false`. In the same context,

> SingleThreadTaskRunner::RunsTasksInCurrentSequence() returns true.

>

> Bug: 1503967

> Change-Id: I017442f10eddda9070a29fb6cf0fa38dcd14a88c

entry.title: [anchor] Pass available PhysicalSize to AnchorEvaluatorImpl constructor
entry.content:
The current API relies on the "just-in-time" SetAxis call to provide

the size along the relevant axis. However, this API is hard to satisfy

when resolving anchor() functions by interleaving style updates from

layout (crbug.com/1510829), as by the time we know the relevant axis,

we're deep in the style code, and we have no idea what the available

size is.



Hence, this CL instead passes the full PhysicalSize to the

AnchorEvaluatorImpl in the first place, and then relies on is_y_axis

to select either the width or the height evaluation-time.



There should be no behavior change in this CL. It's a preparation

that makes it easier to resolve anchor() functions during style

resolution.



Bug: 1510829

Change-Id: Iab2ff2edf7b9b1d0ed44d08d51d69af3bab16799

entry.title: Revert "snap-group: SVOVS creation revamp"
entry.content:
This reverts commit 86b24c235071b778f7de8cc5d5a6e1f020722f5a.



Reason for revert:

Appears to cause MSan failures, like those seen in:

https://ci.chromium.org/ui/p/chromium/builders/ci/Linux%20ChromiumOS%20MSan%20Tests/40979/overview



Original change's description:

> snap-group: SVOVS creation revamp

>

> This cl completed the major revamp of the SVOVS creation by

> focusing on the following items:

> 1. Don't bypass SVOVS creation in `WindowState::OnWMEvent()`;

> 2. Remove `auto_snap_controller_` owned by SVOVS as the instance

> has been owned by `SplitViewController`, with this cl SVOVS can only

> by created through `SplitViewController`;

> 3. Refresh snapped window bounds upon snap group creation and removal

> by adjusting current API;

> 4. Unify handling when divider is created in clamshell in

> `SplitViewDivider::RefreshSplitViewDividerInClamshell()`;

> 5. Further reduce the misusages of the feature flag;

> 6. Remove the !InSplitViewMode() in `SplitViewController` when it

> doesn't make sense.

>

> TODO:

> - The snapped window bounds calculation differ between clamshell and

> tablet split view with the existence of divider. This needs to be

> unified, currently the calculation in snap group is correct;

> - Re-enable the unit test when divider refactor work completes.

>

> Fixed: b/321093825

> Test: Update / fix existing tests + manual

> Change-Id: I3d524b2b77f4d73b6270a6fe46c29fdfa823c2e3

> Reviewed-on: https://chromium-review.googlesource.com/c/chromium/src/+/5242283

entry.title: [css-nesting] Add invisible rules to aid use-counting
entry.content:
Following up CL:5201402, this CL adds "invisible rules",

which can exist in the children of StyleRules and StyleRuleGroups,

but are not visible unless explicitly accessed via

ChildRuleVector::RawChildRules.



Further CLs will add special handling for quiet rules

in StyleCascade, where we'll first cascade with quiet rules for

signaling purposes (see CSSSelector::Signal), then re-cascade

(if needed) without quiet rules to get the author-visible result.



For now, quiet rules are not used outside of tests.

entry.title: Enable RunTasksByBatches by default on ChromeOS and macOS
entry.content:
It seems that crrev.com/1209460 intended to enable "RunTasksByBatches"

on ChromeOS and MacOS. However, it changed the defaults for

base::kRunTasksByBatches, which is not used. The one in use seems to be

the

base::sequence_manager::internal::anonymous_namespace::kRunTasksByBatches.



Remove the latter and switch to using the former. The opposite does not

work because ProductionSupportedFlagList.java references

BaseFeatures.RUN_TASKS_BY_BATCHES.



Caveat: I do not have links, internal or external, to evidence that

these defaults are better. Assuming olivierli@ and fdoray@ have the

data.

entry.title: Remove TestPrefetchURLLoaderInterceptor
entry.content:
`PrefetchService::GetPrefetchToServe` was totally skipped

in `PrefetchURLLoaderInterceptorTest` because of

`TestPrefetchURLLoaderInterceptor::GetPrefetch`, but this

made the invariants different between tests and non-test code,

for example as discussed in [1].



To make the test coverage more realistic,

this CL removes `TestPrefetchURLLoaderInterceptor` and

use the non-test `PrefetchURLLoaderInterceptor` and

`PrefetchService` code instead.



By doing so, this CL re-enables

`DoNotInterceptNavigationCookiesChanged` test that was

removed due to this invariant inconsistency.



[1] https://chromium-review.googlesource.com/c/chromium/src/+/5232813/comment/459b89b8_b127a828/

entry.title: [wpt] Fix unhandled rejection in `scrollend-event-not-fired-...html`
entry.content:
This WPT checks for the absence of a scrollend event by waiting for the

`waitForScrollendEvent()` helper to reject. However, if the rejection

occurs before attaching handlers, the rejection may be returned when

running the test with WebDriver [1] and cause the overall harness status

to flake. The `promise_test()` can still pass because it only awaits the

handled promise.



De-flake the test by immediately attaching the handlers. See also: [2].



[1]: https://wpt.fyi/results/dom/events/scrolling/scrollend-event-not-fired-on-no-scroll.html?label=master&label=experimental&aligned

[2]: https://jakearchibald.com/2023/unhandled-rejections/



Bug: 1499775

Change-Id: I6d7b18053c6ec00ee86dc31914a4a41f9d063ec2

entry.title: [Default Nav Transition]Add GetBackForwardTransitionAnimationManager
entry.content:
on WebContentsView



Currently WCImpl casts [1] a WebContentsView to WebContentsViewAndroid

to get the AnimationManager. However when we attach the inner WC we

replace the WebContentsView from the platform specific impl to

WebContentsViewChildFrame [2]. Then the cast in [1] becomes a bad cast.



A proper way to do this is to have a public API on WebContentsView,

and have platform specific implementations.



Big thanks to Khushal for spotting this.



[1]: https://crsrc.org/c/content/browser/web_contents/web_contents_impl.cc;drc=25a9dc176029598d968de92e6cfd7dcb5e6246e4;l=10590

[2]: https://crsrc.org/c/content/browser/web_contents/web_contents_impl.cc;l=2779;drc=25a9dc176029598d968de92e6cfd7dcb5e6246e4

entry.title: Revert "Rework text-shadow painting for text decorations"
entry.content:
This reverts commit babe4ea7fdb96aff28ef6a4166abd969eac95a1e.



Reason for revert: Doesn't handle non-opaque colors correctly.



Original change's description:

> Rework text-shadow painting for text decorations

>

> The current painting code-path for text-decorations with text-shadows is

> complicated: line-throughs are painted using a draw-looper while the

> rest of the decorations are painted for each shadow "layer" using a

> DropShadowPaintFilter.

>

> Unify these two by introducing a ScopedTextShadowPainter object that

> constructs a filter - either a single DropShadowPaintFilter or a merge

> filter combining one DropShadowPaintFilter for each layer. This makes

> the two cases consistent, and for non-line-through decorations there's

> no longer a need to run the paint code for each shadow "layer".

>

> Bug: 1521809

> Change-Id: I81235c3882f6518b9e94ccb3235a58787a7410e3

> Reviewed-on: https://chromium-review.googlesource.com/c/chromium/src/+/5237135

> Reviewed-by: Stephen Chenney

> Commit-Queue: Fredrik Söderquist

> Cr-Commit-Position: refs/heads/main@{#1253280}



Bug: 1521809

Change-Id: I8dbb4a3b2ba8cf064c6117cd5c82a997e5addbb0

entry.title: iwa: Let SafeWebBundleParser process disconnects
entry.content:
The main aim of this CL to move logic that is processing disconnects

into SafeWebBundleParser class. Conceptually this functionality belongs

to this class as IIUC its aim is to isolate user from IPC related

things.



This CL slightly changes the behavior: in case of disconnect

there will be an attempt to reestablish the connection and after that

in case of failure the error will be returned.



The reconnection is done in a similar way to how we do it now: delete

the old parser&co and create a new one.



For testability reason (and potentially for the different locations of

the Signed Web Bundles, e.g. it might be in memory) I used strategy

design patterns which allows to change how WebBundleDataSource is

created.



Bug: b/320728815

Test: Run and changed existing tests

entry.title: [DBSC] Measure effectiveness of error handling
entry.content:
This CL adds metrics recording the outcome of a request after it had

been deferred by DBSC and what triggered the request release.



One of the expectations we want to check is that network requests

released with the kNetworkConnectionOffline reason should almost always

fail.



It'd be great to record what exact network error led to the

kCookieRefreshFetchFailure outcome. We might want to add more specific

buckets to ResumeBlockedRequestsTrigger in the future CLs.



The outcome of a request is only known in GoogleURLLoaderThrottle, so to

record the histograms we need to plumb a

chrome::mojom::ResumeBlockedRequestsTrigger value from throttled request

handlers through the return value of the existing

BoundSessionRequestThrottledHandler.HandleRequestBlockedOnCookie() Mojo

message.



An alternative to that would be to signal the request result through a

new message in the BoundSessionRequestThrottledHandler Mojo interface,

which seemed less optimal.



Bug: b/292511796

Change-Id: Ic8739f1c788699c1b9fd34024175487c03f11958

Reviewed-on: https://chromium-review.googlesource.com/c/chromium/src/+/5237372

entry.title: Don't load non-stored types from AddressAutofillTable
entry.content:
When writing an address to the database, it is persisted as a list of

(type, value) pairs, for every types in

GetDatabaseStoredTypesOfAutofillProfile().



When reading a profile, an address is constructed by calling

SetRawInfo() for every type found in the database, independently of

what GetDatabaseStoredTypesOfAutofillProfile() is.

Since GetDatabaseStoredTypesOfAutofillProfile() is not explicitly

checked, the code might call loading code downstream with non-stored

types. This can in turn lead to CHECK() failures, crashing Chrome on

startup [1]. This is possible e.g. when the database was tampered with

by external means, or when a stored type becomes non-stored.



This CL checks that if the loaded types are stored types and discards

the others.



[1] https://source.chromium.org/chromium/chromium/src/+/main:components/autofill/core/browser/profile_token_quality.cc;l=299;drc=bf39f1210258bfe98ab635146d3417f537518842



Bug: 1522955

Change-Id: I3ecadb468946d90e4f7b08082166439d680ccca0

Reviewed-on: https://chromium-review.googlesource.com/c/chromium/src/+/5246007

Reviewed-by: Jihad Hanna

Commit-Queue: Florian Leimgruber

Cr-Commit-Position: refs/heads/main@{#1253836}

entry.title: Check pointer before calling
entry.content:
If `EndDragging` was called in the dragging loop after dragging already ends, the second call may not have a drag state, so we just gracefully return.



The exact reason for this condition is unknown, but probably occurs do to multiple unawaited mouseups or races between two drags. Nevertheless, since a drag_state can only be missing if a dragging ends, the above solution is a robust and correct solution.



Fixed: 1519386

entry.title: [accessibility] Migrate to ScopedAccessibilityMode
entry.content:
Migrate callers of BrowserAccessibilityState::AddAccessibilityModeFlags

to ScopedAccessibilityMode. No functional changes for the most part

except for:



- Accessibility is now turned off for a WebContents when ReadAnything is

finished with it, except for the ReadAnythingPermanentAccessibility

study, which is a holdback study that retains the previous behavior.

- AccessibilityUIMessageHandler now clears global and per-page flags set

by the user upon destruction.

- BrowserAccessibilityState::EnableAccessibility now modifies the flags

only once -- removal of non-additive modes is done along with the

addition of new modes.

- WebContentsImpl::RecordAccessibilityEvents now clears mode flags that

were added for the duration fo the recording session.

- Recording accessibility events for a WebContents now only turns on

accessibility for that one WebContents rather than all in the process.



Bug: 1470199

Low-Coverage-Reason: OTHER accessibility_ui.cc has no tests

Change-Id: Ib4d50c8586a1cc10919431616784646377424db6

AX-Relnotes: n/a.

Commit-Queue: Greg Thompson

entry.title: Add null check of font name during matching on Mac
entry.content:
Some broken fonts may lack a postscript name (nameID="6"), full font

name (nameId="4") or family name (nameID="1") in the 'name' font table

[0]. For these fonts CoreText may return null when calling the

corresponding API, [1]. Chrome is using CoreText API in order to

retrieve font name information during font matching and font fallback

for character selection on Mac. The latter caused crashes from [2].



This CL adds null check to different font name types retrieved using

CoreText API.



The changes were tested locally by modifying "Lato" font from Google

Fonts [3] and removing the corresponding lines in its cmap table and

using it in the unit test.



In order to reproduce the issue locally, it will require the modified

"Lato" font to be installed in the system, which makes it hard to

reproduce the issue on the trybot.



[0] https://learn.microsoft.com/en-us/typography/opentype/spec/name

[1] https://developer.apple.com/documentation/coretext/1511240-ctfontcopyname?language=objc

[2] https://crbug.com/1521364

[3] https://fonts.google.com/specimen/Lato



Bug: 1521364, b/322700882

Change-Id: Ib70f615ed2d4697d1b5173b5a19d869e86b73c0a

entry.title: Add experiment to always bounce the tab grid
entry.content:
When there is less than a screenful of tabs, the tab grid didn’t bounce.

With this CL, we explicitly set the bouncing behavior based on a

dedicated flag.



Why: Compositional Layout enables that flag implicitly and we are seeing

differences in MobileTabGridUserScrolled and

MobileTabGridSelectRemotePanel when enabling Compositional Layout.

We would like to understand if those discrepancies are related to tha

Always-Bounce behavior.

entry.title: Add general ReadContentSettings() mojo method
entry.content:
Now that ContentSettingsType is exposed to Typescript

(https://crrev.com/c/5135275) this now gives us the ability to request

content settings for any type from the debug page.



Many content settings don't have default values, which causes the

`NOTREACHED()` in DefaultProvider::GetRuleIterator() to assert. The

interface definition for this method says returning nullptr indicates

the iterator is empty, so this should be safe to remove.

entry.title: Reland "Implement sanitization feature for ChromeOS"
entry.content:
This is a reland of commit 6d634c547e10a40291b6c796857e00d112a59ae3, the initial land had to be reverted as "Sanitize" had not been added to the actions.xml file which caused a linux presubmit to fail.



Original change's description:

> Implement sanitization feature for ChromeOS

>

> This CL implements the sanitization feature for ChromeOS. This feature

> aims to provide a "soft reset" to the users. In this feature some

> settings which could potentially be used for malicious purposes are

> disabled/reset. For example all extensions are disabled, and homepage

> settings is reset. However, cookies are not removed and no personal data

> is removed as part of this process. This CL is the first of N CLs

> needed for this feature but currently includes most of the

> functionality. The rest of the CLs will focus more on user experience.

> The screenshots for the sanitize row and dialog could be found in the

> following links:

> https://screenshot.googleplex.com/3S7WL7sbRXutbWf.png

> https://screenshot.googleplex.com/8zStJQFrok3hAvy.png

>

entry.title: [blink/canvas] Add a feature to reclaim transfer memory when hibernating
entry.content:
To transfer the snapshot of an hibernated canvas, shared memory must be

allocated. It's not freed until the next frame, which thus wastes memory

since a renderer hosting an hibernating canvas is in background, and not

producing frames.



This CL adds a feature to address this.

On a 14 inch macbook pro, this saves 29MiB for a single google docs tab,

when canvas hibernation is enabled, which is not the case by default.

Similar (albeit smaller, since this depends on screen resolution, unless

the client has a High-DPI screen) savings should be observed on other

platforms.



Bug: 1511658

entry.content:

SettingsBase class instead and let the Settings class inherit from it.



Type information is now derived from the 'include_paths' key in

settings.json5 rather than requiring explicit includes in settings.h.



Conversion from string to settings value is moved to a new file named

settings_string_converter.h.



A future CL will add support per-platform initial values - for now the

(two) existing cases are moved to the .cc template file.

entry.content:

worker, which is loaded via `import` by the main SW script.

the imported SW script. This behavior is especially needed for some

developers providing a service worker script as a 3rd party service for

other sites.

Picker search field.

results above the search field.

regardless of whether the caret is near the top or bottom of the screen.

entry.title: Add WebSocketError for WebSocketStream
entry.content:
WebSocketError is a subclass of DOMException that has `closeCode` and

`reason` attributes which can be set by the constructor.



A WebSocketError object can be passed to the writer abort() and reader

cancel() methods to close the WebSocket with a specific `closeCode` and

`reason`.



`closeCode` is used instead of `code` because DOMExceptions already have

a `code` member with a different meaning. Change the WebSocketCloseInfo

dictionary `code` member to `closeCode` for consistency.



Reject promises with WebSocketError.



BUG=983030

entry.title: Let ScreenAI service have concurrent data models in memory.
entry.content:
ScreenAI service runs a single thread and if library initialization

requests are received for different services, it runs them sequentially.

However it loads the model files for initialization async and while it

is reading model files for one, an init request for the other service

my arrive.



We can block this in the browser side (and make sure a second init

request is not sent when one is in progress), but that will make the

service router more complicated. Instead this CL removes the limitation

of having only one set of model data in memory and allows reading model

data for two (or more) services at the same time.



This can result in more memory for the fraction of second that the

library is initializing the first service, and all model data files are

released when initializations are completed.



Browser tests are added to verify this [rare] situation.



AX-Relnotes: n/a

entry.title: [CloudOpenMetrics] Add crash keys before dumping state
entry.content:
Crash reports are sent with DumpWithoutCrashing() whenever the

CloudOpenMetrics object detects a metric is inconsistent. Add crash keys

which distinguish which metric had what inconsistency to

make the crash reports query-able.



For example, if Task Result is Incorrectly Not Logged for the OneDrive

flow, the key is "CloudOpenMetrics-INL" and the value is

"FileBrowser.OfficeFiles.TaskResult.OneDrive".



The query in go/crash would be:

```

EXISTS (SELECT 1 FROM UNNEST(productdata) WHERE key='CloudOpenMetrics

INL' AND value='FileBrowser.OfficeFiles.TaskResult.OneDrive') AND

product_name="Chrome_ChromeOS"

```



Bug: b/322064620

Change-Id: I6486a5fb82249b3b9947cb4b118776afa4e32f9c

entry.title: Reland "Add basic logic for positioning the Picker widget near the caret."
entry.content:
This is a reland of commit 1a754aaf4bbf5bc9352e55a32f537cce0e43dcba



The original CL kept a const reference to the screen work area while

computing Picker bounds. This failed sanitizer tests since we don't

know the lifetime of the screen- it could be a temporary fake screen.



To fix this, copy the screen work area instead: see diff between

Patchset 1 and Patchset 3.



(Also make some other changes so that we're not overriding Layout()

to set the Picker widget bounds. See Patchset 4 and onwards.)



Original change's description:

> Add basic logic for positioning the Picker widget near the caret.

>

> - If there is space to the right of the caret, place the Picker widget

> to the right of the caret and try to vertically align the Picker

> search field with the caret.

> - Otherwise, place the Picker widget above or below the caret.

>

> Since we want to align the Picker search field with the caret, we only

> position the Picker widget after PickerView layout has happened.

>

> Note that various cases still need to be dealt with (e.g. when there is

> a selection instead of a caret). We'll handle these cases in followups.

>

> Bug: b:320787410, b:322281223

> Change-Id: I7cf427f3c8aa1e229c7a1cdcae1e3939457905aa

> Reviewed-on: https://chromium-review.googlesource.com/c/chromium/src/+/5233749

entry.title: snap-group: SVOVS creation revamp
entry.content:
This cl completed the major revamp of the SVOVS creation by

focusing on the following items:

1. Don't bypass SVOVS creation in `WindowState::OnWMEvent()`;

2. Remove `auto_snap_controller_` owned by SVOVS as the instance

has been owned by `SplitViewController`, with this cl SVOVS can only

by created through `SplitViewController`;

3. Refresh snapped window bounds upon snap group creation and removal

by adjusting current API;

4. Unify handling when divider is created in clamshell in

`SplitViewDivider::RefreshSplitViewDividerInClamshell()`;

5. Further reduce the misusages of the feature flag;

6. Remove the !InSplitViewMode() in `SplitViewController` when it

doesn't make sense.



TODO:

- The snapped window bounds calculation differ between clamshell and

tablet split view with the existence of divider. This needs to be

unified, currently the calculation in snap group is correct;

- Re-enable the unit test when divider refactor work completes.



Fixed: b/321093825

Test: Update / fix existing tests + manual

entry.title: Add fuzzy matching to BackgroundImage test
entry.content:
Adds a fuzzy matching algorithm to the Pixel_BackgroundImage test to

allow any number of pixels to differ by up to 1 on each channel. This

test produces a fairly detailed image and has historically had a lot of

off-by-one differences, so this should hopefully reduce the number of

images that need to be manually triaged in a safe way.

entry.title: documentScan: Simplify scanner id token tracking
entry.content:
The backend now generates per-client anonymized tokens for scanners

instead of returning the SANE connection. This allows the backend to

make use of its more detailed knowledge of device availability to change

the tokens when needed instead of on every GetScannerList call.



Since these tokens are already anonymous, DocumentScanAPIHandler no

longer needs to replace them with its own tokens. Instead, remove all

that tracking logic and just track the set of active scanner IDs for

each extension. Now that the handler is able to clear scanner IDs per

extension instead of globally, it also makes sense to clear the lists of

scanner handles and job handles at the same time to avoid having them

grow indefinitely.



Finally, this also removes the shared scanner_devices map in favor of

tracking directly inside ExtensionState. The keys provided by the

backend are no longer shared across extensions, so each extension is

effectively only accessing a disjoint slice of the shared map anyway.



Bug: b/316152239

Bug: b/315310310

Test: Scan with test extension

Change-Id: Ic0351e42d3b087369068c9833efe10063120ab09

Reviewed-on: https://chromium-review.googlesource.com/c/chromium/src/+/5241243
